• Why.
  • Coin.
  • Why.

Faculty Feedback doesn't make sense, do you believe the teachers cannot see our ratings?
And how do we judge the influence of every student?

Also, what's stopping me from giving dishonest feedback,

Maybe I give everyone 100%

We need a baseline, and in this competive world; the best way to do that is to rate teachers relative to each other;
Everyone gets 12 coins for the semester, which they may use to give their teachers, this is the infinity coin;

But each student may get only 12.
They must distribute this among their faculty;


Giving all to their favorite;

Or distributing it to their 'friends' to vote on their behalf

Every faculty starts out with 0 in their wallet, but may end the semester with multiple;

This is where the market comes in: teachers may sell their coins, reducing their balance;
Which brings us to the question, why?

-> 'Bonus' Passive Income for excellent teachers, an 'incentive' to teach well

-> A way of transferring income from the other teachers to the better ones.

-> A way for the college to measure performance

-> Instills a sense of capitalistic demcracy amongst students, as the students with a high balance are going to be very influential;

-> Commitees with a high balance will automatically be seen as better

-> This is because one can see how many coins were sent out ( not to whom ) in the end of the semester if the student wishes to make this data public
